body_html:
I'm downloading the MobileNet_v1_1.0_224_quant gzip from the link I already provided,
https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/research/slim/nets/mobilenet_v1.md
unzip it, and you'll find the tflite flatbuffer.
The schemas are in the Tensorflow layout, along with upgrade_schema.py
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/schema

I installed flatbuffers from Anaconda
conda install -c conda-forge flatbuffers

Then run the flatc command I already provided:
flatc -t schema.fbs -- mobilenet_v1_1.0_224_quant.tflite

That will create the json file.
As I said, though, I now suspect that the issue is that json is just displaying the bias data as bytes rather than as int32 values. I haven't confirmed it yet, but it seems to me it would be too big of an error to have been missed if the bias data not there at all. I just assumed it would be there as 32 bit signed data, in the same form as in the Netron viewer.
You can see the bias data by opening the tflite file in the Netron viewer and clicking on any of the bias tabs.
https://github.com/lutzroeder/netron

I'm downloading the MobileNet_v1_1.0_224_quant gzip from the link I already provided,
https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/research/slim/nets/mobilenet_v1.md
unzip it, and you'll find the tflite flatbuffer.
The schemas are in the Tensorflow layout, along with upgrade_schema.py
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/schema
I installed flatbuffers from Anaconda
conda install -c conda-forge flatbuffers
Then run the flatc command I already provided:
flatc -t schema.fbs -- mobilenet_v1_1.0_224_quant.tflite
That will create the json file.
As I said, though, I now suspect that the issue is that json is just displaying the bias data as bytes rather than as int32 values.  I haven't confirmed it yet, but it seems to me it would be too big of an error to have been missed if the bias data not there at all.  I just assumed it would be there as 32 bit signed data, in the same form as in the Netron viewer.
You can see the bias data by opening the tflite file in the Netron viewer and clicking on any of the bias tabs.
https://github.com/lutzroeder/netron
body:
I'm downloading the MobileNet_v1_1.0_224_quant gzip from the link I already provided, 
https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/research/slim/nets/mobilenet_v1.md
unzip it, and you'll find the tflite flatbuffer.
The schemas are in the Tensorflow layout, along with upgrade_schema.py
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/schema

I installed flatbuffers from Anaconda
conda install -c conda-forge flatbuffers 

Then run the flatc command I already provided:
flatc -t schema.fbs -- mobilenet_v1_1.0_224_quant.tflite

That will create the json file.
As I said, though, I now suspect that the issue is that json is just displaying the bias data as bytes rather than as int32 values.  I haven't confirmed it yet, but it seems to me it would be too big of an error to have been missed if the bias data not there at all.  I just assumed it would be there as 32 bit signed data, in the same form as in the Netron viewer.
You can see the bias data by opening the tflite file in the Netron viewer and clicking on any of the bias tabs.
https://github.com/lutzroeder/netron
